xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This XQuery Module contains functions for performing admin-centric operations such as managing database users and log data.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:author: BaseX Team

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns an element sequence with all currently opened sessions, including the user name, address (IP:port) and an optionally opened database. The output of this function and the SHOW SESSIONS command is similar.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: admin:sessions
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function admin:sessions() as element(session)* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Returns Logging data compiled by the database or HTTP server:
If no argument is specified, a list of all log files will be returned, including the file size and date.
If a $date is specified, the contents of a single log file will be returned.
If $merge is set to true, related log entries will be merged. Please note that the merge might not be 100% successful, as log entries may be ambiguous.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: admin:logs
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function admin:logs() as element(file)* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Returns Logging data compiled by the database or HTTP server:
If no argument is specified, a list of all log files will be returned, including the file size and date.
If a $date is specified, the contents of a single log file will be returned.
If $merge is set to true, related log entries will be merged. Please note that the merge might not be 100% successful, as log entries may be ambiguous.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: admin:logs
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function admin:logs($date as xs:string) as element(entry)* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Returns Logging data compiled by the database or HTTP server:
If no argument is specified, a list of all log files will be returned, including the file size and date.
If a $date is specified, the contents of a single log file will be returned.
If $merge is set to true, related log entries will be merged. Please note that the merge might not be 100% successful, as log entries may be ambiguous.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: admin:logs
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function admin:logs($date as xs:string, $merge as xs:boolean) as element(entry)* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Writes a string to the database logs, along with current user data (timestamp, user name). If the function is called in a web application or a database client, the IP will be logged. Otherwise, the string STANDALONE will be logged.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: admin:write-log
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function admin:write-log($text as xs:string) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This XQuery Module contains functions to handle archives (including ePub, Open Office, JAR, and many other formats). New ZIP and GZIP archives can be created, existing archives can be updated, and the archive entries can be listed and extracted. The archive:extract-binary function includes an example for writing the contents of an archive to disk.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:author: BaseX Team

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Creates a new archive from the specified entries and contents. The $entries argument contains meta information required to create new entries. All items may either be of type xs:string , representing the entry name, or element(archive:entry) , containing the name as text node and additional, optional attributes:
last-modified: timestamp, specified as xs:dateTime (default: current time)
compression-level: 0-9, 0 = uncompressed (default: 8)
encoding: for textual entries (default: UTF-8)
An example: <archive:entry last-modified='2011-11-11T11:11:11' compression-level='8' encoding='US-ASCII'>hello.txt</archive:entry>
The actual $contents must be xs:string or xs:base64Binary items. The $options parameter contains archiving options, which can either be specified
as children of an <archive:options/> element: <archive:options> <archive:format value="zip"/> <archive:algorithm value="deflate"/> </archive:options>
as map, which contains all key/value pairs: map { "format": "zip", "algorithm": "deflate" }
Currently, the following combinations are supported (all others will be rejected):
zip: algorithm may be stored or deflate
gzip: algorithm may be deflate
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:ARCH0001 the number of entries and contents differs.
bxerr:ARCH0002 the specified option or its value is invalid or not supported.
bxerr:ARCH0003 entry descriptors contain invalid entry names, timestamps or compression levels.
bxerr:ARCH0004 the specified encoding is invalid or not supported, or the string conversion failed. Invalid XML characters will be ignored if the CHECKSTRINGS option is turned off.
bxerr:ARCH0005 the chosen archive format only allows single entries.
bxerr:ARCH9999 archive creation failed for some other reason.
bxerr:FORG0006 an argument has a wrong type.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: archive:create
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function archive:create($entries as item(), $contents as item()*) as xs:base64Binary external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Creates a new archive from the specified entries and contents. The $entries argument contains meta information required to create new entries. All items may either be of type xs:string , representing the entry name, or element(archive:entry) , containing the name as text node and additional, optional attributes:
last-modified: timestamp, specified as xs:dateTime (default: current time)
compression-level: 0-9, 0 = uncompressed (default: 8)
encoding: for textual entries (default: UTF-8)
An example: <archive:entry last-modified='2011-11-11T11:11:11' compression-level='8' encoding='US-ASCII'>hello.txt</archive:entry>
The actual $contents must be xs:string or xs:base64Binary items. The $options parameter contains archiving options, which can either be specified
as children of an <archive:options/> element: <archive:options> <archive:format value="zip"/> <archive:algorithm value="deflate"/> </archive:options>
as map, which contains all key/value pairs: map { "format": "zip", "algorithm": "deflate" }
Currently, the following combinations are supported (all others will be rejected):
zip: algorithm may be stored or deflate
gzip: algorithm may be deflate
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:ARCH0001 the number of entries and contents differs.
bxerr:ARCH0002 the specified option or its value is invalid or not supported.
bxerr:ARCH0003 entry descriptors contain invalid entry names, timestamps or compression levels.
bxerr:ARCH0004 the specified encoding is invalid or not supported, or the string conversion failed. Invalid XML characters will be ignored if the CHECKSTRINGS option is turned off.
bxerr:ARCH0005 the chosen archive format only allows single entries.
bxerr:ARCH9999 archive creation failed for some other reason.
bxerr:FORG0006 an argument has a wrong type.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: archive:create
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function archive:create($entries as item(), $contents as item()*, $options as item()) as xs:base64Binary external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Returns the entry descriptors of the specified $archive . A descriptor contains the following attributes, provided that they are available in the archive format:
size: original file size
last-modified: timestamp, formatted as xs:dateTime
compressed-size: compressed file size
An example: <archive:entry size="1840" last-modified="2009-03-20T03:30:32" compressed-size="672"> doc/index.html </archive:entry>
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:ARCH9999 archive creation failed for some other reason.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: archive:entries
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function archive:entries($archive as xs:base64Binary) as element(archive:entry)* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the options of the specified $archive in the format specified by archive:create .
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:ARCH0002 The packing format is not supported.
bxerr:ARCH9999 archive creation failed for some other reason.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: archive:options
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function archive:options($archive as xs:base64Binary) as element(archive:options) external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Extracts entries of the specified $archive and returns them as texts. The returned entries can be limited via $entries . The format of the argument is the same as for archive:create (attributes will be ignored). The encoding of the input files can be specified via $encoding .
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:ARCH0004 the specified encoding is invalid or not supported, or the string conversion failed. Invalid XML characters will be ignored if the CHECKSTRINGS option is turned off.
bxerr:ARCH9999 archive creation failed for some other reason.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: archive:extract-text
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function archive:extract-text($archive as xs:base64Binary) as xs:string* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Extracts entries of the specified $archive and returns them as texts. The returned entries can be limited via $entries . The format of the argument is the same as for archive:create (attributes will be ignored). The encoding of the input files can be specified via $encoding .
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:ARCH0004 the specified encoding is invalid or not supported, or the string conversion failed. Invalid XML characters will be ignored if the CHECKSTRINGS option is turned off.
bxerr:ARCH9999 archive creation failed for some other reason.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: archive:extract-text
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function archive:extract-text($archive as xs:base64Binary, $entries as item()*) as xs:string* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Extracts entries of the specified $archive and returns them as texts. The returned entries can be limited via $entries . The format of the argument is the same as for archive:create (attributes will be ignored). The encoding of the input files can be specified via $encoding .
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:ARCH0004 the specified encoding is invalid or not supported, or the string conversion failed. Invalid XML characters will be ignored if the CHECKSTRINGS option is turned off.
bxerr:ARCH9999 archive creation failed for some other reason.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: archive:extract-text
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function archive:extract-text($archive as xs:base64Binary, $entries as item()*, $encoding as xs:string) as xs:string* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Extracts entries of the specified $archive and returns them as binaries. The returned entries can be limited via $entries . The format of the argument is the same as for archive:create (attributes will be ignored).
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:ARCH9999 archive creation failed for some other reason.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: archive:extract-binary
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function archive:extract-binary($archive as xs:base64Binary) as xs:string* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Extracts entries of the specified $archive and returns them as binaries. The returned entries can be limited via $entries . The format of the argument is the same as for archive:create (attributes will be ignored).
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:ARCH9999 archive creation failed for some other reason.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: archive:extract-binary
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function archive:extract-binary($archive as xs:base64Binary, $entries as item()*) as xs:base64Binary* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Creates an updated version of the specified $archive with new or replaced entries. The format of $entries and $contents is the same as for archive:create .
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:ARCH0001 the number of entries and contents differs.
bxerr:ARCH0003 entry descriptors contain invalid entry names, timestamps, compression levels or encodings.
bxerr:ARCH0004 the specified encoding is invalid or not supported, or the string conversion failed. Invalid XML characters will be ignored if the CHECKSTRINGS option is turned off.
bxerr:ARCH0005 the entries of the given archive cannot be modified.
bxerr:ARCH9999 archive creation failed for some other reason.
bxerr:FORG0006 (some of) the contents are not of type xs:string or xs:base64Binary .

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: archive:update
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function archive:update($archive as xs:base64Binary, $entries as item()*, $contents as item()*) as xs:base64Binary external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Deletes entries from an $archive . The format of $entries is the same as for archive:create .
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:ARCH0005 the entries of the given archive cannot be modified.
bxerr:ARCH9999 archive creation failed for some other reason.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: archive:delete
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function archive:delete($archive as xs:base64Binary, $entries as item()*) as xs:base64Binary external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This convenience function directly writes files of an $archive to the specified directory $path . The entries to be written can be limited via $entries . The format of the argument is the same as for archive:create (attributes will be ignored).
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:FILE0001 a specified path does not exist.
bxerr:ARCH9999 archive creation failed for some other reason.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: archive:write
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function archive:write($path as xs:string, $archive as xs:base64Binary) as xs:string* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This convenience function directly writes files of an $archive to the specified directory $path . The entries to be written can be limited via $entries . The format of the argument is the same as for archive:create (attributes will be ignored).
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:FILE0001 a specified path does not exist.
bxerr:ARCH9999 archive creation failed for some other reason.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: archive:write
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function archive:write($path as xs:string, $archive as xs:base64Binary, $entries as item()*) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
This XQuery Module contains functions for manipulating arrays, which will officially be introduced with XQuery 3.1 .
Please note that the functions are subject to change until the specification has reached its final stage.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:author: BaseX Team

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the number of members in $array . Note that because an array is an item, the fn:count function when applied to an array always returns 1 .

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: array:size
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function array:size($input as array(*)) as xs:integer external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the $array member at the specified $position .
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: :FOAY0001 $position is not in the range 1 to array:size($array) inclusive.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: array:get
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function array:get($array as array(*), $position as xs:integer) as item()* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns a copy of $array with a new $member attached.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: array:append
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function array:append($array as array(*), $member as item()*) as array(*) external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Constructs a new array with with $length members of $array beginning from the specified $position . The two-argument version of the function returns the same result as the three-argument version when called with $length equal to the value of array:size($array) - $position + 1 .
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: :FOAY0001 $position is less than one, or if $position + $length is greater than array:size($array) + 1 .
:FOAY0002 $length is less than zero.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: array:subarray
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function array:subarray($array as array(*), $position as xs:integer) as array(*) external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Constructs a new array with with $length members of $array beginning from the specified $position . The two-argument version of the function returns the same result as the three-argument version when called with $length equal to the value of array:size($array) - $position + 1 .
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: :FOAY0001 $position is less than one, or if $position + $length is greater than array:size($array) + 1 .
:FOAY0002 $length is less than zero.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: array:subarray
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function array:subarray($array as array(*), $position as xs:integer, $length as xs:integer) as array(*) external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns a copy of $array without the member at the specified $position .
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: :FOAY0001 $position is not in the range 1 to array:size($array) inclusive.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: array:remove
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function array:remove($array as array(*), $position as xs:integer) as array(*) external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns a copy of $array with one new $member at the specified $position . Setting $position to the value array:size($array) + 1 yields the same result as array:append($array, $insert) .
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: :FOAY0001 $position is not in the range 1 to array:size($array) + 1 inclusive.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: array:insert-before
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function array:insert-before($array as array(*), $position as xs:integer, $member as item()*) as array(*) external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the first member of $array . This function is equivalent to the expression $array(1) .
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: :FOAY0001 The array is empty.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: array:head
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function array:head($array as array(*)) as item()* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns a new array with all members except the first from $array . This function is equivalent to the expression array:remove($array, 1) .
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: :FOAY0001 The array is empty.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: array:tail
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function array:tail($array as array(*)) as array(*) external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns a new array with all members of $array in reverse order.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: array:reverse
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function array:reverse($array as array(*)) as array(*) external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Concatenates the contents of several $arrays into a single array.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: array:join
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function array:join($arrays as (array(*))*) as array(*) external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Recursively flattens all arrays that occur in the supplied $items .

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: array:flatten
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function array:flatten($items as item()*) as item()* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns a new array, in which each member is computed by applying $function to the corresponding member of $array .

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: array:for-each
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function array:for-each($array as array(*), $function as function(item()*) as item()*) as array(*) external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns a new array with those members of $array for which $function returns true .

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: array:filter
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function array:filter($array as array(*), $function as function(item()*) as xs:boolean) as array(*) external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Evaluates the supplied $function cumulatively on successive members of the supplied $array from left to right and using $zero as first argument.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: array:fold-left
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function array:fold-left($array as array(*), $zero as item()*, $function as function(item()*, item()*) as item()*) as item()* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Evaluates the supplied $function cumulatively on successive members of the supplied $array from right to left and using $zero as first argument.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: array:fold-right
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function array:fold-right($array as array(*), $zero as item()*, $function as function(item()*, item()*) as item()*) as item()* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns a new array obtained by evaluating the supplied $function for each pair of members at the same position in $array1 and $array2 .

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: array:for-each-pair
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function array:for-each-pair($array1 as array(*), $array2 as array(*), $function as function(item()*) as item()*) as array(*) external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns a new array with sorted $array members. If a sort $key function is given, it will be applied on all array members. The items of the resulting values will be sorted using the semantics of the lt expression.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: array:sort
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function array:sort($array as array(*)) as array(*) external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns a new array with sorted $array members. If a sort $key function is given, it will be applied on all array members. The items of the resulting values will be sorted using the semantics of the lt expression.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: array:sort
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function array:sort($array as array(*), $key as function(item()*) as xs:anyAtomicType*) as array(*) external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This function is specific to BaseX. It returns a string representation of the supplied array. The purpose of this function is to get an insight into the structure of an array item; it cannot necessarily be used for reconstructing the original array.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: array:serialize
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function array:serialize($input as array(*)) as xs:string external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This XQuery Module contains functions to process binary data, including extracting subparts, searching, basic binary operations and conversion between binary and structured forms. This module is based on the EXPath Binary Module .
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:author: BaseX Team

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the binary form of the set of octets written as a sequence of (ASCII) hex digits ([0-9A-Fa-f]). $in will be effectively zero-padded from the left to generate an integral number of octets, i.e. an even number of hexadecimal digits. If $in is an empty string, then the result will be an xs:base64Binary with no embedded data. Byte order in the result follows (per-octet) character order in the string. If the value of $in is the empty sequence, the function returns an empty sequence.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: :non-numeric-character the input cannot be parsed as a hexadecimal number.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: bin:hex
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function bin:hex($in as xs:string?) as xs:base64Binary? external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the binary form of the set of octets written as a sequence of (8-wise) (ASCII) binary digits ([01]). $in will be effectively zero-padded from the left to generate an integral number of octets. If $in is an empty string, then the result will be an xs:base64Binary with no embedded data. Byte order in the result follows (per-octet) character order in the string. If the value of $in is the empty sequence, the function returns an empty sequence.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: :non-numeric-character the input cannot be parsed as a binary number.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: bin:bin
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function bin:bin($in as xs:string?) as xs:base64Binary? external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the binary form of the set of octets written as a sequence of (ASCII) octal digits ([0-7]). $in will be effectively zero-padded from the left to generate an integral number of octets. If $in is an empty string, then the result will be an xs:base64Binary with no embedded data. Byte order in the result follows (per-octet) character order in the string. If the value of $in is the empty sequence, the function returns an empty sequence.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: :non-numeric-character the input cannot be parsed as an octal number.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: bin:octal
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function bin:octal($in as xs:string?) as xs:base64Binary? external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns binary data as a sequence of octets. If $in is a zero length binary data then the empty sequence is returned. Octets are returned as integers from 0 to 255.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: bin:to-octets
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function bin:to-octets($in as xs:base64Binary) as xs:integer* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Converts a sequence of octets into binary data. Octets are integers from 0 to 255. If the value of $in is the empty sequence, the function returns zero-sized binary data.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: :octet-out-of-range one of the octets lies outside the range 0 - 255.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: bin:from-octets
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function bin:from-octets($in as xs:integer*) as xs:base64Binary external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the size of binary data in octets.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: bin:length
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function bin:length($in as xs:base64Binary) as xs:integer external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns a section of binary data starting at the $offset octet. If $size is specified, the size of the returned binary data is $size octets. If $size is absent, all remaining data from $offset is returned. The $offset is zero based. If the value of $in is the empty sequence, the function returns an empty sequence.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: :negative-size the specified size is negative.
:index-out-of-range the specified offset + size is out of range.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: bin:part
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function bin:part($in as xs:base64Binary?, $offset as xs:integer) as xs:base64Binary? external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns a section of binary data starting at the $offset octet. If $size is specified, the size of the returned binary data is $size octets. If $size is absent, all remaining data from $offset is returned. The $offset is zero based. If the value of $in is the empty sequence, the function returns an empty sequence.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: :negative-size the specified size is negative.
:index-out-of-range the specified offset + size is out of range.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: bin:part
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function bin:part($in as xs:base64Binary?, $offset as xs:integer, $size as xs:integer) as xs:base64Binary? external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns an xs:base64Binary created by concatenating the items in the sequence $in , in order. If the value of $in is the empty sequence, the function returns a binary item containing no data bytes.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: bin:join
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function bin:join($in as xs:base64Binary*) as xs:base64Binary external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns binary data consisting sequentially of the data from $in up to and including the $offset - 1 octet, followed by all the data from $extra , and then the remaining data from $in . The $offset is zero based. If the value of $in is the empty sequence, the function returns an empty sequence.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: :index-out-of-range the specified offset is out of range.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: bin:insert-before
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function bin:insert-before($in as xs:base64Binary?, $offset as xs:integer, $extra as xs:base64Binary?) as xs:base64Binary? external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns an xs:base64Binary created by padding the input with $size octets in front of the input. If $octet is specified, the padding octets each have that value, otherwise they are zero. If the value of $in is the empty sequence, the function returns an empty sequence.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: :negative-size the specified size is negative.
:octet-out-of-range the specified octet lies outside the range 0-255.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: bin:pad-left
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function bin:pad-left($in as xs:base64Binary?, $size as xs:integer) as xs:base64Binary? external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns an xs:base64Binary created by padding the input with $size octets in front of the input. If $octet is specified, the padding octets each have that value, otherwise they are zero. If the value of $in is the empty sequence, the function returns an empty sequence.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: :negative-size the specified size is negative.
:octet-out-of-range the specified octet lies outside the range 0-255.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: :negative-size the specified size is negative.
:octet-out-of-range the specified octet lies outside the range 0-255.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the first location of the binary search sequence in the input, or if not found, the empty sequence. The $offset and the returned location are zero based. If the value of $in is the empty sequence, the function returns an empty sequence.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: :index-out-of-range the specified offset + size is out of range.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Decodes binary data as a string in a given $encoding . If $offset and $size are provided, the $size octets from $offset are decoded. :index-out-of-range the specified offset + size is out of range.

:conversion-error an error or malformed input occurred during decoding the string.

If $offset alone is provided, octets from $offset to the end are decoded.If the value of $in is the empty sequence, the function returns an empty sequence.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: :unknown-significance-order the specified octet order is unknown.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function bin:pack-double($in as xs:double) as xs:base64Binary external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: :unknown-significance-order the specified octet order is unknown.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function bin:pack-double($in as xs:double, $octet-order as xs:string) as xs:base64Binary external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the 4-octet binary representation of a float value. Most-significant-octet-first number representation is assumed unless the $octet-order parameter is specified.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: :unknown-significance-order the specified octet order is unknown.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: bin:pack-float
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function bin:pack-float($in as xs:float) as xs:base64Binary external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: :unknown-significance-order the specified octet order is unknown.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: bin:pack-float
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function bin:pack-float($in as xs:float, $octet-order as xs:string) as xs:base64Binary external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the twos-complement binary representation of an integer value treated as $size octets long. Any 'excess' high-order bits are discarded. Most-significant-octet-first number representation is assumed unless the $octet-order parameter is specified. Specifying a $size of zero yields an empty binary data.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: :unknown-significance-order the specified octet order is unknown.
:negative-size the specified size is negative.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function bin:pack-integer($in as xs:integer, $size as xs:integer) as xs:base64Binary external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the twos-complement binary representation of an integer value treated as $size octets long. Any 'excess' high-order bits are discarded. Most-significant-octet-first number representation is assumed unless the $octet-order parameter is specified. Specifying a $size of zero yields an empty binary data.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: :unknown-significance-order the specified octet order is unknown.
:negative-size the specified size is negative.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: :index-out-of-range the specified offset is out of range.
:unknown-significance-order the specified octet order is unknown.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function bin:unpack-double($in as xs:base64Binary, $offset as xs:integer) as xs:double external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Extracts the double value stored at the particular offset in binary data. Most-significant-octet-first number representation is assumed unless the $octet-order parameter is specified. The $offset is zero based.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: :index-out-of-range the specified offset is out of range.
:unknown-significance-order the specified octet order is unknown.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: bin:unpack-double
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function bin:unpack-double($in as xs:base64Binary, $offset as xs:integer, $octet-order as xs:string) as xs:double external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Extracts the float value stored at the particular offset in binary data. Most-significant-octet-first number representation is assumed unless the $octet-order parameter is specified. The $offset is zero based.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: :index-out-of-range the specified offset + size is out of range.
:unknown-significance-order the specified octet order is unknown.

:unknown-significance-order the specified octet order is unknown.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function bin:unpack-float($in as xs:base64Binary, $offset as xs:integer, $octet-order as xs:string) as xs:float external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns a signed integer value represented by the $size octets starting from $offset in the input binary representation. Necessary sign extension is performed (i.e. the result is negative if the high order bit is '1'). Most-significant-octet-first number representation is assumed unless the $octet-order parameter is specified. The $offset is zero based. Specifying a $size of zero yields the integer 0 .
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: :negative-size the specified size is negative.
:index-out-of-range the specified offset + size is out of range.
:unknown-significance-order the specified octet order is unknown.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: bin:unpack-integer
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function bin:unpack-integer($in as xs:base64Binary, $offset as xs:integer, $size as xs:integer) as xs:integer external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns a signed integer value represented by the $size octets starting from $offset in the input binary representation. Necessary sign extension is performed (i.e. the result is negative if the high order bit is '1'). Most-significant-octet-first number representation is assumed unless the $octet-order parameter is specified. The $offset is zero based. Specifying a $size of zero yields the integer 0 .
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: :negative-size the specified size is negative.
:index-out-of-range the specified offset + size is out of range.
:unknown-significance-order the specified octet order is unknown.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: bin:unpack-integer
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function bin:unpack-integer($in as xs:base64Binary, $offset as xs:integer, $size as xs:integer, $octet-order as xs:string) as xs:integer external

Most-significant-octet-first number representation is assumed unless the $octet-order parameter is specified. The $offset is zero based. Specifying a $size of zero yields the integer 0 .
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: :negative-size the specified size is negative.
:index-out-of-range the specified offset + size is out of range.
:unknown-significance-order the specified octet order is unknown.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function bin:unpack-unsigned-integer($in as xs:base64Binary, $offset as xs:integer, $size as xs:integer) as xs:integer external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns an unsigned integer value represented by the $size octets starting from $offset in the input binary representation. Most-significant-octet-first number representation is assumed unless the $octet-order parameter is specified. The $offset is zero based. Specifying a $size of zero yields the integer 0 .
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: :negative-size the specified size is negative.
:index-out-of-range the specified offset + size is out of range.
:unknown-significance-order the specified octet order is unknown.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function bin:unpack-unsigned-integer($in as xs:base64Binary, $offset as xs:integer, $size as xs:integer, $octet-order as xs:string) as xs:integer external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the "bitwise or" of two binary arguments. If either argument is the empty sequence, an empty sequence is returned.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: :differing-length-arguments the input arguments are of differing length.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: bin:or
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function bin:or($a as xs:base64Binary?, $b as xs:base64Binary?) as xs:base64Binary? external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the "bitwise xor" of two binary arguments. If either argument is the empty sequence, an empty sequence is returned.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: :differing-length-arguments the input arguments are of differing length.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: bin:xor
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function bin:xor($a as xs:base64Binary?, $b as xs:base64Binary?) as xs:base64Binary? external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the "bitwise and" of two binary arguments. If either argument is the empty sequence, an empty sequence is returned.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: :differing-length-arguments the input arguments are of differing length.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: bin:and
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function bin:and($a as xs:base64Binary?, $b as xs:base64Binary?) as xs:base64Binary? external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the "bitwise not" of a binary argument. If the argument is the empty sequence, an empty sequence is returned.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: bin:not
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function bin:not($in as xs:base64Binary?) as xs:base64Binary? external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Shifts bits in binary data. If $by is zero, the result is identical to $in . If $by is positive then bits are shifted to the left. Otherwise, bits are shifted to the right. If the absolute value of $by is greater than the bit-length of $in then an all-zeros result is returned. The result always has the same size as $in . The shifting is logical: zeros are placed into discarded bits. If the value of $in is the empty sequence, the function returns an empty sequence.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: bin:shift
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function bin:shift($in as xs:base64Binary?, $by as xs:integer) as xs:base64Binary? external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This XQuery Module contains functions to access remote BaseX server instances from XQuery. With this module, you can on the one hand execute database commands and on the other hand evaluate queries, the results of which are returned as XDM sequences.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:author: BaseX Team

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This function establishes a connection to a remote BaseX server, creates a new client session, and returns a session id. The parameter $host is the name of the database server, $port specifies the server port, and $user and $password represent the login data.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXCL0001 an error occurs while creating the session (possible reasons: server not available, access denied).

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: client:connect
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function client:connect($host as xs:string, $port as xs:integer, $user as xs:string, $password as xs:string) as xs:anyURI external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This function executes a command and returns the result as string. The parameter $id contains the session id returned by client:connect . The $command argument represents a single command, which will be executed by the server.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXCL0003 an I/O error occurs while transferring data from or to the server.
bxerr:BXCL0004 an error occurs while executing a command.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: client:execute
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function client:execute($id as xs:anyURI, $command as xs:string) as xs:string external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This function returns an information string, created by a previous call of client:execute . $id specifies the session id.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: client:info
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function client:info($id as xs:anyURI) as xs:string external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Evaluates a query and returns the result as sequence. The parameter $id contains the session id returned by client:connect , and $query represents the query string, which will be evaluated by the server. Variables and the context item can be declared via $bindings . The specified keys must be QNames or strings:
If a key is a QName, it will be directly adopted as variable name.
If a key is a string, it may be prefixed with a dollar sign. A namespace can be specified using the Clark Notation. If the specified string is empty, the value will be bound to the context item.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXCL0003 an I/O error occurs while transferring data from or to the server.
bxerr:BXCL0005 an error occurs while evaluating a query, and if the original error cannot be extracted from the returned error string.
bxerr:BXCL0006 a value to be bound is no single item.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: client:query
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function client:query($id as xs:anyURI, $query as xs:string) as item()* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Evaluates a query and returns the result as sequence. The parameter $id contains the session id returned by client:connect , and $query represents the query string, which will be evaluated by the server. Variables and the context item can be declared via $bindings . The specified keys must be QNames or strings:
If a key is a QName, it will be directly adopted as variable name.
If a key is a string, it may be prefixed with a dollar sign. A namespace can be specified using the Clark Notation. If the specified string is empty, the value will be bound to the context item.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXCL0003 an I/O error occurs while transferring data from or to the server.
bxerr:BXCL0005 an error occurs while evaluating a query, and if the original error cannot be extracted from the returned error string.
bxerr:BXCL0006 a value to be bound is no single item.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: client:query
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function client:query($id as xs:anyURI, $query as xs:string, $bindings as map(*)) as item()* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This function closes a client session. $id specifies the session id. At the end of query execution, open sessions will be automatically closed.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXCL0003 an I/O error occurs while transferring data from or to the server.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: client:close
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function client:close($id as xs:anyURI) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This XQuery Module contains functions to convert data between different formats.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:author: BaseX Team

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Converts the specifed binary data (xs:base64Binary, xs:hexBinary) to a string. The UTF-8 default encoding can be overwritten with the optional $encoding argument.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXCO0001 The input is an invalid XML string, or the wrong encoding has been specified. Invalid XML characters will be ignored if the CHECKSTRINGS option is turned off.
bxerr:BXCO0002 The specified encoding is invalid or not supported.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: convert:binary-to-string
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function convert:binary-to-string($bytes as xs:anyAtomicType) as xs:string external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Converts the specifed binary data (xs:base64Binary, xs:hexBinary) to a string. The UTF-8 default encoding can be overwritten with the optional $encoding argument.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXCO0001 The input is an invalid XML string, or the wrong encoding has been specified. Invalid XML characters will be ignored if the CHECKSTRINGS option is turned off.
bxerr:BXCO0002 The specified encoding is invalid or not supported.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: convert:binary-to-string
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function convert:binary-to-string($bytes as xs:anyAtomicType, $encoding as xs:string) as xs:string external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Converts the specified string to a xs:base64Binary item. If the default encoding is chosen, conversion will be cheap, as both xs:string and xs:base64Binary items are internally represented as byte arrays. The UTF-8 default encoding can be overwritten with the optional $encoding argument.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXCO0001 The input cannot be represented in the specified encoding.
bxerr:BXCO0002 The specified encoding is invalid or not supported.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function convert:string-to-base64($input as xs:string) as xs:base64Binary external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Converts the specified string to a xs:base64Binary item. If the default encoding is chosen, conversion will be cheap, as both xs:string and xs:base64Binary items are internally represented as byte arrays. The UTF-8 default encoding can be overwritten with the optional $encoding argument.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXCO0001 The input cannot be represented in the specified encoding.
bxerr:BXCO0002 The specified encoding is invalid or not supported.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: convert:string-to-base64
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function convert:string-to-base64($input as xs:string, $encoding as xs:string) as xs:base64Binary external

The UTF-8 default encoding can be overwritten with the optional $encoding argument.

bxerr:BXCO0002 The specified encoding is invalid or not supported.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: convert:string-to-hex
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function convert:string-to-hex($input as xs:string, $encoding as xs:string) as xs:hexBinary external

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function convert:bytes-to-hex($input as xs:byte*) as xs:hexBinary external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the specified binary data (xs:base64Binary, xs:hexBinary) as a sequence of bytes.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: convert:binary-to-bytes
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function convert:binary-to-bytes($bin as xs:anyAtomicType) as xs:byte* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Converts $num to base $base , interpreting it as a 64-bit unsigned integer. The first $base elements of the sequence '0',..,'9','a',..,'z' are used as digits. Valid bases are 2, .., 36 .

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: convert:integer-to-base
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function convert:integer-to-base($num as xs:integer, $base as xs:integer) as xs:string external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Decodes an xs:integer from $str , assuming that it's encoded in base $base . The first $base elements of the sequence '0',..,'9','a',..,'z' are allowed as digits, case doesn't matter. Valid bases are 2 - 36. If $str contains more than 64 bits of information, the result is truncated arbitarily.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: convert:integer-from-base
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function convert:integer-from-base($str as xs:string, $base as xs:integer) as xs:integer external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Converts the specified number of milliseconds since 1 Jan 1970 to an item of type xs:dateTime.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function convert:integer-to-dateTime($ms as xs:integer) as xs:dateTime external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Converts the specified item of type xs:dateTime to the number of milliseconds since 1 Jan 1970.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: convert:dateTime-to-integer
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function convert:dateTime-to-integer($dateTime as xs:dateTime) as xs:integer external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This XQuery Module contains functions to perform cryptographic operations in XQuery. The cryptographic module is based on an early draft of the EXPath Cryptographic Module and provides the following functionality: creation of message authentication codes (HMAC), encryption and decryption, and creation and validation of XML Digital Signatures.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:author: BaseX Team

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Creates a message authentication code via a cryptographic hash function and a secret $key .
$encoding must either be hex, base64 or the empty string and specifies the encoding of the returned authentication code. Default is base64 . $algorithm describes the hash algorithm which is used for encryption. Currently supported are md5, sha1, sha256, sha384, sha512. Default is md5 .
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: experr:CX0013 the specified hashing algorithm is not supported.
experr:CX0014 the specified encoding method is not supported.
experr:CX0019 the specified secret key is invalid.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: crypto:hmac
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function crypto:hmac($message as xs:string, $key as xs:string, $algorithm as xs:string) as xs:string external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Creates a message authentication code via a cryptographic hash function and a secret $key .
$encoding must either be hex, base64 or the empty string and specifies the encoding of the returned authentication code. Default is base64 . $algorithm describes the hash algorithm which is used for encryption. Currently supported are md5, sha1, sha256, sha384, sha512. Default is md5 .
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: experr:CX0013 the specified hashing algorithm is not supported.
experr:CX0014 the specified encoding method is not supported.
experr:CX0019 the specified secret key is invalid.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: crypto:hmac
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function crypto:hmac($message as xs:string, $key as xs:string, $algorithm as xs:string, $encoding as xs:string) as xs:string external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Encrypts the given input string.
$encryption must be symmetric, as asymmetric encryption is not supported so far. Default is symmetric . $key is the secret key which is used for both encryption and decryption of input data. Its length is fixed and depends on the chosen algorithm: 8 bytes for DES, 16 bytes for AES. $algorithm must either be DES or AES. Other algorithms are not supported so far, but, of course, can be added on demand. Default is DES .
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: experr:CX0016 padding problems arise.
experr:CX0017 padding is incorrect.
experr:CX0018 the encryption type is not supported.
experr:CX0019 the secret key is invalid.
experr:CX0020 the block size is incorrect.
experr:CX0021 the specified encryption algorithm is not supported.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: crypto:encrypt
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function crypto:encrypt($input as xs:string, $encryption as xs:string, $key as xs:string, $algorithm as xs:string) as xs:string external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Decrypts the encrypted $input .
$type must be symmetric. An option for asymmetric encryption will most likely be added with another version of BaseX. Default is symmetric . $key is the secret key which is used for both encryption and decryption of input data. Its length is fixed and depends on the chosen algorithm: 8 bytes for DES, 16 bytes for AES. $algorithm must either be DES or AES. Other algorithms are not supported so far, but, of course, can be added on demand. Default is DES .
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: experr:CX0016 padding problems arise.
experr:CX0017 padding is incorrect.
experr:CX0018 the encryption type is not supported.
experr:CX0019 the secret key is invalid.
experr:CX0020 the block size is incorrect.
experr:CX0021 the specified encryption algorithm is not supported.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: crypto:decrypt
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function crypto:decrypt($input as xs:string, $type as xs:string, $key as xs:string, $algorithm as xs:string) as xs:string external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
$canonicalization must either be inclusive-with-comments , inclusive , exclusive-with-comments or exclusive . Default is inclusive-with-comments .
$digest must be one of the following: SHA1, SHA256 or SHA512. Default is SHA1 . $signature must either be RSA_SHA1 or DSA_SHA1. Default is RSA_SHA1 . $prefix may be empty and prefixes the Signature element accordingly. $type is the signature type. It must either be enveloped or enveloping (detached signatures are not supported so far). Default is enveloped . $xpath is an arbitrary XPath expression which specifies a subset of the document that is to be signed. $certificate is the digitial certificate used to sign the input document. $ext may either be an $xpath expression or a $certificate.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: experr:CX0001 the canonicalization algorithm is not supported.
experr:CX0002 the digest algorithm is not supported.
experr:CX0003 the signature algorithm is not supported.
experr:CX0004 the $xpath-expression is invalid.
experr:CX0005 the root name of $digital-certificate is not 'digital-certificate.
experr:CX0007 the key store is null.
experr:CX0012 the key cannot be found in the specified key store.
experr:CX0023 the certificate alias is invalid.
experr:CX0024 an invalid algorithm is specified.
experr:CX0025 an exception occurs while the signing the document.
experr:CX0026 an exception occurs during key store initialization.
experr:CX0027 an IO exception occurs.
experr:CX0028 the signature type is not supported.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This XQuery Module contains a single function to parse CSV input. CSV (comma-separated values) is a popular representation for tabular data, exported e.g. from Excel.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:author: BaseX Team

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Converts the CSV data specified by $input to an XML document or a map. The $options argument can be used to control the way the input is converted.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXCS0001 the input cannot be parsed.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: csv:parse
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function csv:parse($input as xs:string) as document-node(csv) external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Converts the CSV data specified by $input to an XML document or a map. The $options argument can be used to control the way the input is converted.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXCS0001 the input cannot be parsed.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: csv:parse
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function csv:parse($input as xs:string, $options as item()) as item() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Serializes the node specified by $input as CSV data, and returns the result as xs:string . Items can also be serialized as JSON if the Serialization Parameter method is set to csv . The $options argument can be used to control the way the input is serialized.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXCS0002 the input cannot be serialized.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: csv:serialize
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function csv:serialize($input as node()) as xs:string external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Serializes the node specified by $input as CSV data, and returns the result as xs:string . Items can also be serialized as JSON if the Serialization Parameter method is set to csv . The $options argument can be used to control the way the input is serialized.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXCS0002 the input cannot be serialized.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: csv:serialize
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function csv:serialize($input as node(), $options as item()) as xs:string external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This XQuery Module contains functions for processing databases from within XQuery. Existing databases can be opened and listed, its contents can be directly accessed, documents can be added to and removed, etc.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:author: BaseX Team

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns information on the database system, such as the database path and current database settings. The output is similar to the INFO command.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: db:system
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function db:system() as element(system) external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns meta information on the database $db . The output is similar to the INFO DB command.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXDB0002 The addressed database does not exist or could not be opened.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: db:info
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function db:info($db as xs:string) as element(database) external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Returns a string sequence with the names of all databases:
If a database $db is specified, all documents and raw files of the specified database are returned.
The list of resources can be further restricted by the $path argument.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXDB0002 The addressed database does not exist or could not be opened.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: db:list
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function db:list() as xs:string* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:

If a database $db is specified, all documents and raw files of the specified database are returned.
The list of resources can be further restricted by the $path argument.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXDB0002 The addressed database does not exist or could not be opened.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: db:list
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function db:list($db as xs:string) as xs:string* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Returns a string sequence with the names of all databases:
If a database $db is specified, all documents and raw files of the specified database are returned.
The list of resources can be further restricted by the $path argument.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXDB0002 The addressed database does not exist or could not be opened.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: db:list
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function db:list($db as xs:string, $path as xs:string) as xs:string* external

ul.li: If no argument is specified, a sequence of elements is returned. A single element contains the name of a database, the number of stored resources, the date of modification, and the database path.

If $db is specified, a sequence of elements is returned, comprising information on all resources of the addressed database. An element contains the name of the resource, the content type, the modified date, and the raw flag.
Returned databases resources can be further restricted by the $path argument.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXDB0002 The addressed database does not exist or could not be opened.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: db:list-details
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function db:list-details() as element(database)* external

ul.li: If no argument is specified, a sequence of elements is returned. A single element contains the name of a database, the number of stored resources, the date of modification, and the database path.

If $db is specified, a sequence of elements is returned, comprising information on all resources of the addressed database. An element contains the name of the resource, the content type, the modified date, and the raw flag.
Returned databases resources can be further restricted by the $path argument.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXDB0002 The addressed database does not exist or could not be opened.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: db:list-details
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function db:list-details($db as xs:string) as element(resource)* external

ul.li: If no argument is specified, a sequence of elements is returned. A single element contains the name of a database, the number of stored resources, the date of modification, and the database path.

If $db is specified, a sequence of elements is returned, comprising information on all resources of the addressed database. An element contains the name of the resource, the content type, the modified date, and the raw flag.
Returned databases resources can be further restricted by the $path argument.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXDB0002 The addressed database does not exist or could not be opened.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function db:list-details($db as xs:string, $path as xs:string) as element(resource)* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns an element sequence containing all available database backups. If a database $db is specified, the sequence will be restricted to the backups matching this database.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: db:backups
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function db:backups() as element(backup)* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns an element sequence containing all available database backups. If a database $db is specified, the sequence will be restricted to the backups matching this database.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: db:backups
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function db:backups($db as xs:string) as element(backup)* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Executes a $query and sends the resulting value to all clients watching the Event with the specified $name . The query may also perform updates; no event will be sent to the client that fired the event.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXDB0010 the specified event is unknown.
bxerr:SEPM0016 serialization errors occurred while sending the value.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: db:event
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function db:event($name as xs:string, $query as item()) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Opens the database $db and returns all document nodes. The document nodes to be returned can be filtered with the $path argument.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXDB0002 The addressed database does not exist or could not be opened.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: db:open
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function db:open($db as xs:string) as document-node()* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Opens the database $db and returns all document nodes. The document nodes to be returned can be filtered with the $path argument.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXDB0002 The addressed database does not exist or could not be opened.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: db:open
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function db:open($db as xs:string, $path as xs:string) as document-node()* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Opens the database $db and returns the node with the specified $pre value. The PRE value provides very fast access to an existing database node, but it will change whenever a node with a smaller pre values is added to or deleted from a database.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXDB0002 The addressed database does not exist or could not be opened.
bxerr:BXDB0009 the specified pre value does not exist in the database.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: db:open-pre
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function db:open-pre($db as xs:string, $pre as xs:integer) as node() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Opens the database $db and returns the node with the specified $id value. Each database node has a persistent ID value . Access to the node id can be sped up by turning on the UPDINDEX option.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXDB0002 The addressed database does not exist or could not be opened.
bxerr:BXDB0009 the specified id value does not exist in the database.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: db:open-id
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function db:open-id($db as xs:string, $id as xs:integer) as node() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the pre values of the nodes supplied by $nodes , which must all be database nodes . The PRE value provides very fast access to an existing database node, but it will change whenever a node with a smaller pre values is added to or deleted from a database.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXDB0001 $nodes contains a node which is not stored in a database.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: db:node-pre
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function db:node-pre($nodes as node()*) as xs:integer* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the id values of the nodes supplied by $nodes , which must all be database nodes . Each database node has a persistent ID value . Access to the node id can be sped up by turning on the UPDINDEX option.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXDB0001 $nodes contains a node which is not stored in a database.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: db:node-id
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function db:node-id($nodes as node()*) as xs:integer* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns a binary resource addressed by the database $db and $path as streamable xs:base64Binary .
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXDB0002 The addressed database does not exist or could not be opened.
bxerr:BXDB0003 the database is not persistent (stored on disk).
bxerr:FODC0002 the addressed resource cannot be retrieved.
bxerr:FODC0007 the specified path is invalid.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: db:retrieve
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function db:retrieve($db as xs:string, $path as xs:string) as xs:base64Binary external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXDB0002 The addressed database does not exist or could not be opened.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function db:export($db as xs:string, $path as xs:string) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXDB0002 The addressed database does not exist or could not be opened.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function db:export($db as xs:string, $path as xs:string, $params as item()) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns all text nodes of the database $db that have $string as their string value. If available, the value index is used to speed up evaluation.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns all text nodes of the database $db that are located in between the $min and $max strings. If available, the value index is used to speed up evaluation.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXDB0002 The addressed database does not exist or could not be opened.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: db:text-range
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function db:text-range($db as xs:string, $min as xs:string, $max as xs:string) as text()* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns all attribute nodes of the database $db that have $string as string value. If available, the value index is used to speed up evaluation. If $attname is specified, the resulting attribute nodes are filtered by their attribute name.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: db:attribute
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function db:attribute($db as xs:string, $string as item()) as attribute()* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns all attribute nodes of the database $db that have $string as string value. If available, the value index is used to speed up evaluation. If $attname is specified, the resulting attribute nodes are filtered by their attribute name.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: db:attribute
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function db:attribute($db as xs:string, $string as item(), $attname as xs:string) as attribute()* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns all attributes of the database $db , the string values of which are larger than or equal to $min and smaller than or equal to $max . If available, the value index is used to speed up evaluation.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXDB0002 The addressed database does not exist or could not be opened.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: db:attribute-range
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function db:attribute-range($db as xs:string, $min as xs:string, $max as xs:string) as attribute()* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns all attributes of the database $db , the string values of which are larger than or equal to $min and smaller than or equal to $max . If available, the value index is used to speed up evaluation.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXDB0002 The addressed database does not exist or could not be opened.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function db:attribute-range($db as xs:string, $min as xs:string, $max as xs:string, $attname as xs:string) as attribute()* external
