xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This XQuery Module contains functions for extracting internal information about modules and functions and generating documentation.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:author: BaseX Team

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns function items for all user-defined functions (both public and private) that are known in the current query context. If a $uri is specified, the addressed file will be compiled, its functions will be added to the query context and returned to the user.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: inspect:functions
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function inspect:functions() as (function(*))* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns function items for all user-defined functions (both public and private) that are known in the current query context. If a $uri is specified, the addressed file will be compiled, its functions will be added to the query context and returned to the user.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: inspect:functions
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function inspect:functions($uri as xs:string) as (function(*))* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Inspects the specified $function and returns an element that describes its structure. The output of this function is similar to eXist-dbs inspect:inspect-function function.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: inspect:function
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function inspect:function($function as function(*)) as element(function) external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Generates an element that describes all variables and functions in the current query context.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: inspect:context
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function inspect:context() as element(context) external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Retrieves the string from the specified $input , parses it as XQuery module, and generates an element that describes its structure.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: xqdoc:FODC0002 the addressed resource cannot be retrieved.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: inspect:module
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function inspect:module($input as xs:string) as element(module) external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Retrieves the string from the specified $input , parses it as XQuery module, and generates an xqDoc element. xqDoc provides a simple vendor neutral solution for generating a documentation from XQuery modules. The documentation conventions have been inspired by the JavaDoc standard. Documentation comments begin with ~ and end with , and tags start with @ . xqDoc comments can be specified for main and library modules and variable and function declarations.
We have slightly extended the xqDoc conventions to do justice to the current status of XQuery (Schema: xqdoc-1.1.30052013.xsd):
an <xqdoc:annotations/> node is added to each variable or function that uses annotations. The xqdoc:annotation child nodes may have additional xqdoc:literal elements with type attributes (xs:string, xs:integer, xs:decimal, xs:double) and values.
a single <xqdoc:namespaces/> node is added to the root element, which summarizes all prefixes and namespace URIs used or declared in the module.
name and type elements are added to variables
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: xqdoc:FODC0002 the addressed resource cannot be retrieved.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: inspect:xqdoc
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function inspect:xqdoc($input as xs:string) as element(xqdoc:xqdoc) external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This XQuery Module contains functions to parse and serialize JSON documents. JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) is a popular data exchange format for applications written in JavaScript. As there are notable differences between JSON and XML, no mapping exists that guarantees a lossless, bidirectional conversion between JSON and XML. For this reason, we offer various mappings, all of which are suited to different use cases.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:author: BaseX Team

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Converts the JSON document specified by $input to an XML document or a map. If the input can be successfully parsed, it can be serialized back to the original JSON representation. The $options argument can be used to control the way the input is converted.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXJS0001 the specified input cannot be parsed as JSON document.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: json:parse
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function json:parse($input as xs:string) as element(json) external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Converts the JSON document specified by $input to an XML document or a map. If the input can be successfully parsed, it can be serialized back to the original JSON representation. The $options argument can be used to control the way the input is converted.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXJS0001 the specified input cannot be parsed as JSON document.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: json:parse
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function json:parse($input as xs:string, $options as item()) as item() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Serializes the node specified by $input as JSON, and returns the result as xs:string instance. The node is expected to conform to the output created by the json:parse() function. All other items will be serialized as specified for the json output method of the official specification. Items can also be serialized as JSON if the Serialization Parameter method is set to json . The $options argument can be used to control the way the input is serialized.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXJS0002 the specified node cannot be serialized as JSON document.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: json:serialize
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function json:serialize($input as node()) as xs:string external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Serializes the node specified by $input as JSON, and returns the result as xs:string instance. The node is expected to conform to the output created by the json:parse() function. All other items will be serialized as specified for the json output method of the official specification. Items can also be serialized as JSON if the Serialization Parameter method is set to json . The $options argument can be used to control the way the input is serialized.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXJS0002 the specified node cannot be serialized as JSON document.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: json:serialize
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function json:serialize($input as node(), $options as item()) as xs:string external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
This XQuery Module contains functions for manipulating maps, which will officially be introduced with XQuery 3.1 .
Please note that the functions are subject to change until the specification has reached its final stage.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:author: BaseX Team

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Returns true if the map supplied as $input contains an entry with a key equal to the supplied value of $key ; otherwise it returns false. No error is raised if the map contains keys that are not comparable with the supplied $key .
If the supplied key is xs:untypedAtomic, it is compared as an instance of xs:string. If the supplied key is the xs:float or xs:double value NaN, the function returns true if there is an entry whose key is NaN, or false otherwise.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: map:contains
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function map:contains($input as map(*), $key as xs:anyAtomicType) as xs:boolean external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Creates a new map containing a single entry. The key of the entry in the new map is $key , and its associated value is $value . If the supplied key is xs:untypedAtomic , it is compared as an instance of xs:string . If the supplied key is the xs:float or xs:double value NaN , the function returns the value in the entry whose key is NaN , or the empty sequence otherwise.
The function map:entry is intended primarily for use in conjunction with the function map:merge . For example, a map containing seven entries may be constructed like this: map:merge(( map:entry("Su", "Sunday"), map:entry("Mo", "Monday"), map:entry("Tu", "Tuesday"), map:entry("We", "Wednesday"), map:entry("Th", "Thursday"), map:entry("Fr", "Friday"), map:entry("Sa", "Saturday") ))
Unlike the map { ... } expression, this technique can be used to construct a map with a variable number of entries, for example: map:merge(for $b in //book return map:entry($b/isbn, $b))

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: map:entry
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function map:entry($key as xs:anyAtomicType, $value as item()*) as map(*) external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Applies a function to every entry of the map $input and returns the results as a sequence. The function supplied as $fun takes two arguments. It is called supplying the key of the map entry as the first argument, and the associated value as the second argument.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: map:for-each
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function map:for-each($input as map(*), $fun as function(xs:anyAtomicType, item()*) as item()) as item()* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Returns the value associated with a supplied key in a given map. This function attempts to find an entry within the map supplied as $input that has a key equal to the supplied value of $key . If there is such an entry, it returns the associated value; otherwise it returns an empty sequence. No error is raised if the map contains keys that are not comparable with the supplied $key . If the supplied key is xs:untypedAtomic , it is converted to xs:string . If the supplied key is the xs:float or xs:double value NaN , the function returns an empty sequence.
A return value of () from map:get could indicate that the key is present in the map with an associated value of (), or it could indicate that the key is not present in the map. The two cases can be distinguished by calling map:contains. Invoking the map as a function item has the same effect as calling get: that is, when $input is a map, the expression $input($K) is equivalent to get($input, $K). Similarly, the expression get(get(get($input, 'employee'), 'name'), 'first') can be written as $input('employee')('name')('first').

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: map:get
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function map:get($input as map(*), $key as xs:anyAtomicType) as item()* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns a sequence containing all the key values present in a map. The function takes any map as its $input argument and returns the keys that are present in the map as a sequence of atomic values. The order may differ from the order in which entries were inserted in the map.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: map:keys
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function map:keys($input as map(*)) as xs:anyAtomicType* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Constructs and returns a new map. The map is formed by combining the contents of the maps supplied in the $input argument. The maps are combined as follows:
There is one entry in the new map for each distinct key value present in the union of the input maps, where keys are considered distinct according to the rules of the distinct-values function.
The associated value for each such key is taken from the last map in the input sequence $input that contains an entry with this key.
There is no requirement that the supplied input maps should have the same or compatible types. The type of a map (for example map(xs:integer, xs:string)) is descriptive of the entries it currently contains, but is not a constraint on how the map may be combined with other maps.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: map:merge
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function map:merge($input as (map(*))*) as map(*) external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Creates a new map , containing the entries of the $input argument and a new entry composed by $key and $value . The semantics of this function are equivalent to map:merge(($input, map { $key, $value }))

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: map:put
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function map:put($input as map(*), $key as xs:anyAtomicType, $value as item()*) as map(*) external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Constructs a new map by removing an entry from an existing map. The entries in the new map correspond to the entries of $input , excluding any entry whose key is equal to $key .
No failure occurs if the input map contains no entry with the supplied key; the input map is returned unchanged

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: map:remove
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function map:remove($input as map(*), $key as xs:anyAtomicType) as map(*) external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns a the number of entries in the supplied map. The function takes any map as its $input argument and returns the number of entries that are present in the map.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: map:size
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function map:size($input as map(*)) as xs:integer external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This function is specific to BaseX. It returns a string representation of the supplied map. The purpose of this function is to get an insight into the structure of a map item; it cannot necessarily be used for reconstructing the original map.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: map:serialize
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function map:serialize($input as map(*)) as xs:string external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: The math XQuery Module defines functions to perform mathematical operations, such as pi , asin and acos . Most functions are specified in the Functions and Operators Specification of the upcoming XQuery 3.0 Recommendation, and some additional ones have been added in this module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:author: BaseX Team

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the xs:double value of the mathematical constant whose lexical representation is 3.141592653589793.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:pi
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:pi() as xs:double external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the square root of $arg . If $arg is the empty sequence, the empty sequence is returned. Otherwise the result is the xs:double value of the mathematical square root of $arg .

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:sqrt
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:sqrt($arg as xs:double?) as xs:double? external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the sine of the $arg , expressed in radians. If $arg is the empty sequence, the empty sequence is returned. Otherwise the result is the sine of $arg , treated as an angle in radians.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:sin
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:sin($arg as xs:double?) as xs:double? external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the cosine of $arg , expressed in radians. If $arg is the empty sequence, the empty sequence is returned. Otherwise the result is the cosine of $arg , treated as an angle in radians.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:cos
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:cos($arg as xs:double?) as xs:double? external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the tangent of $arg , expressed in radians. If $arg is the empty sequence, the empty sequence is returned. Otherwise the result is the tangent of $arg , treated as an angle in radians.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:tan
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:tan($arg as xs:double?) as xs:double? external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the arc sine of $arg . If $arg is the empty sequence, the empty sequence is returned. Otherwise the result is the arc sine of $arg , returned as an angle in radians in the range -/2 to +/2.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:asin
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:asin($arg as xs:double?) as xs:double? external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the arc cosine of $arg . If $arg is the empty sequence, the empty sequence is returned. Otherwise the result is the arc cosine of $arg , returned as an angle in radians in the range 0 to +.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:acos
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:acos($arg as xs:double?) as xs:double? external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the arc tangent of $arg . If $arg is the empty sequence, the empty sequence is returned. Otherwise the result is the arc tangent of $arg , returned as an angle in radians in the range -/2 to +/2.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:atan
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:atan($arg as xs:double?) as xs:double? external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the arc tangent of $arg1 divided by $arg2 , the result being in the range -/2 to +/2 radians. If $arg1 is the empty sequence, the empty sequence is returned. Otherwise the result is the arc tangent of $arg1 divided by $arg2 , returned as an angle in radians in the range - to +.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:atan2
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:atan2($arg1 as xs:double?, $arg2 as xs:double) as xs:double? external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns $arg1 raised to the power of $arg2 . If $arg1 is the empty sequence, the empty sequence is returned. Otherwise the result is the $arg1 raised to the power of $arg2 .

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:pow
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:pow($arg1 as xs:double?, $arg2 as xs:double) as xs:double? external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns e raised to the power of $arg . If $arg is the empty sequence, the empty sequence is returned. Otherwise the result is the value of e raised to the power of $arg .

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:exp
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:exp($arg as xs:double?) as xs:double? external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the natural logarithm of $arg . If $arg is the empty sequence, the empty sequence is returned. Otherwise the result is the natural logarithm (base e ) of $arg .

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:log
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:log($arg as xs:double?) as xs:double? external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the base 10 logarithm of $arg . If $arg is the empty sequence, the empty sequence is returned. Otherwise the result is the base 10 logarithm of $arg .

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:log10
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:log10($arg as xs:double?) as xs:double? external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the xs:double value of the mathematical constant e whose lexical representation is 2.718281828459045.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:e
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:e() as xs:double external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the hyperbolic sine of $arg . If $arg is the empty sequence, the empty sequence is returned. Otherwise the result is the hyperbolic sine of $arg .

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:sinh
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:sinh($arg as xs:double?) as xs:double? external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the hyperbolic cosine of $arg . If $arg is the empty sequence, the empty sequence is returned. Otherwise the result is the hyperbolic cosine of $arg .

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:cosh
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:cosh($arg as xs:double?) as xs:double? external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the hyperbolic tangent of $arg . If $arg is the empty sequence, the empty sequence is returned. Otherwise the result is the hyperbolic tangent of $arg .

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:tanh
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:tanh($arg as xs:double?) as xs:double? external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Calculates the CRC32 check sum of the given string $str .

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: math:crc32
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function math:crc32($str as xs:string) as xs:hexBinary external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This XQuery Module contains functions for simplifying formatted data output.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:author: BaseX Team

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Returns a single newline character ( 
 ).

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: out:nl
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function out:nl() as xs:string external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns a single tabulator character ( 	 ).

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: out:tab
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function out:tab() as xs:string external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns a formatted string. $item1 and all following items are applied to the $format string, according to Javas printf syntax .

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: out:format
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function out:format($format as xs:string, $item1 as item()) as xs:string external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This XQuery Module provides functions for executing system commands from XQuery.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:author: BaseX Team

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Executes the specified command in a separate process and returns the result as string. $cmd is the name of the command. Arguments to the command may be specified via $args . The result can be explicitly converted to a specified $encoding . If no encoding is specified, the systems default encoding is used.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXPRnnnn If the command results in an error, an XQuery error will be raised. Its code will consist of the letters BXPR and four digits with the commands exit code.
bxerr:BXPR9999 the specified encoding does not exist or is not supported.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: proc:system
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function proc:system($cmd as xs:string) as xs:string external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Executes the specified command in a separate process and returns the result as string. $cmd is the name of the command. Arguments to the command may be specified via $args . The result can be explicitly converted to a specified $encoding . If no encoding is specified, the systems default encoding is used.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXPRnnnn If the command results in an error, an XQuery error will be raised. Its code will consist of the letters BXPR and four digits with the commands exit code.
bxerr:BXPR9999 the specified encoding does not exist or is not supported.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: proc:system
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function proc:system($cmd as xs:string, $args as xs:string*) as xs:string external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Executes the specified command in a separate process and returns the result as string. $cmd is the name of the command. Arguments to the command may be specified via $args . The result can be explicitly converted to a specified $encoding . If no encoding is specified, the systems default encoding is used.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXPRnnnn If the command results in an error, an XQuery error will be raised. Its code will consist of the letters BXPR and four digits with the commands exit code.
bxerr:BXPR9999 the specified encoding does not exist or is not supported.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: proc:system
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function proc:system($cmd as xs:string, $args as xs:string*, $encoding as xs:string) as xs:string external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Executes the specified command in a separate process and returns the result as element. $cmd is the name of the command. Arguments to the command may be specified via $args . The result can be explicitly converted to a specified $encoding . If no encoding is specified, the systems default encoding is used. A result has the following structure: ...result output... ...error output... 0
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXPR9999 the specified encoding does not exist or is not supported.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: proc:execute
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function proc:execute($cmd as xs:string) as element(result) external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Executes the specified command in a separate process and returns the result as element. $cmd is the name of the command. Arguments to the command may be specified via $args . The result can be explicitly converted to a specified $encoding . If no encoding is specified, the systems default encoding is used. A result has the following structure: ...result output... ...error output... 0
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXPR9999 the specified encoding does not exist or is not supported.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: proc:execute
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function proc:execute($cmd as xs:string, $args as xs:string*) as element(result) external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Executes the specified command in a separate process and returns the result as element. $cmd is the name of the command. Arguments to the command may be specified via $args . The result can be explicitly converted to a specified $encoding . If no encoding is specified, the systems default encoding is used. A result has the following structure: ...result output... ...error output... 0
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXPR9999 the specified encoding does not exist or is not supported.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: proc:execute
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function proc:execute($cmd as xs:string, $args as xs:string*, $encoding as xs:string) as element(result) external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This XQuery Module contains various testing, profiling and helper functions.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:author: BaseX Team

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Measures the time needed to evaluate $expr and sends it to standard error or, if the GUI is used, to the Info View. If $cache is set to true() , the result will be temporarily cached. This way, a potential iterative execution of the expression (which often yields different memory usage) is blocked. A third, optional argument $label may be specified to tag the profiling result. The function is non-deterministic : evaluation order will be preserved by the compiler.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: prof:time
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function prof:time($expr as item()) as item()* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Measures the time needed to evaluate $expr and sends it to standard error or, if the GUI is used, to the Info View. If $cache is set to true() , the result will be temporarily cached. This way, a potential iterative execution of the expression (which often yields different memory usage) is blocked. A third, optional argument $label may be specified to tag the profiling result. The function is non-deterministic : evaluation order will be preserved by the compiler.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: prof:time
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function prof:time($expr as item(), $cache as xs:boolean) as item()* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Measures the time needed to evaluate $expr and sends it to standard error or, if the GUI is used, to the Info View. If $cache is set to true() , the result will be temporarily cached. This way, a potential iterative execution of the expression (which often yields different memory usage) is blocked. A third, optional argument $label may be specified to tag the profiling result. The function is non-deterministic : evaluation order will be preserved by the compiler.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: prof:time
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function prof:time($expr as item(), $cache as xs:boolean, $label as xs:string) as item()* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Measures the memory allocated by evaluating $expr and sends it to standard error or, if the GUI is used, to the Info View. If $cache is set to true() , the result will be temporarily cached. This way, a potential iterative execution of the expression (which often yields different memory usage) is blocked. A third, optional argument $label may be specified to tag the profiling result. The function is non-deterministic : evaluation order will be preserved by the compiler.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: prof:mem
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function prof:mem($expr as item()) as item()* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Measures the memory allocated by evaluating $expr and sends it to standard error or, if the GUI is used, to the Info View. If $cache is set to true() , the result will be temporarily cached. This way, a potential iterative execution of the expression (which often yields different memory usage) is blocked. A third, optional argument $label may be specified to tag the profiling result. The function is non-deterministic : evaluation order will be preserved by the compiler.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: prof:mem
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function prof:mem($expr as item(), $cache as xs:boolean) as item()* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Measures the memory allocated by evaluating $expr and sends it to standard error or, if the GUI is used, to the Info View. If $cache is set to true() , the result will be temporarily cached. This way, a potential iterative execution of the expression (which often yields different memory usage) is blocked. A third, optional argument $label may be specified to tag the profiling result. The function is non-deterministic : evaluation order will be preserved by the compiler.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: prof:mem
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function prof:mem($expr as item(), $cache as xs:boolean, $label as xs:string) as item()* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Sleeps for the specified number of milliseconds. The function is non-deterministic : evaluation order will be preserved by the compiler.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: prof:sleep
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function prof:sleep($ms as xs:integer) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns a human-readable representation of the specified $number .

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: prof:human
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function prof:human($number as xs:integer) as xs:string external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Dumps a serialized representation of $expr to STDERR , optionally prefixed with $label , and returns an empty sequence. If the GUI is used, the dumped result is shown in the Info View . In contrast to fn:trace() , the consumed expression will not be passed on.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: prof:dump
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function prof:dump($expr as item()) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Dumps a serialized representation of $expr to STDERR , optionally prefixed with $label , and returns an empty sequence. If the GUI is used, the dumped result is shown in the Info View . In contrast to fn:trace() , the consumed expression will not be passed on.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: prof:dump
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function prof:dump($expr as item(), $label as xs:string) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Prints a list of all current local and global variable assignments to standard error or, if the GUI is used, to the Info View. As every query is optimized before being evaluated, not all of the original variables may be visible in the output. Moreover, many variables of function calls will disappear because functions are inlined. Function inlining can be turned off by setting the INLINELIMIT option to 0 . The function is non-deterministic : evaluation order will be preserved by the compiler.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: prof:variables
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function prof:variables() as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the number of milliseconds passed since 1970/01/01 UTC. The granularity of the value depends on the underlying operating system and may be larger. For example, many operating systems measure time in units of tens of milliseconds. In contrast to fn:current-time() , the function is non-deterministic , as it returns different values every time it is called. Its evaluation order will be preserved by the compiler.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: prof:current-ms
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function prof:current-ms() as xs:integer external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the current value of the most precise available system timer in nanoseconds. In contrast to fn:current-time() , the function is non-deterministic , as it returns different values every time it is called. Its evaluation order will be preserved by the compiler.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: prof:current-ns
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function prof:current-ns() as xs:integer external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Swallows all items of the specified $value and returns an empty sequence. This function is helpful if some code needs to be evaluated and if the actual result is irrelevant. The function is non-deterministic : evaluation order will be preserved by the compiler.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: prof:void
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function prof:void($value as item()*) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This XQuery Module contains functions for computing random values. All functions except for random:seeded-double and random:seeded-integer are non-deterministic, i.e., they return different values for each call.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:author: BaseX Team

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns a double value between 0.0 (inclusive) and 1.0 (exclusive).

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: random:double
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function random:double() as xs:double external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns an integer value, either in the whole integer range or between 0 (inclusive) and the given maximum (exclusive)
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXRA0001 the maximum value is out of bounds.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: random:integer
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function random:integer() as xs:integer external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns an integer value, either in the whole integer range or between 0 (inclusive) and the given maximum (exclusive)
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXRA0001 the maximum value is out of bounds.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: random:integer
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function random:integer($max as xs:integer) as xs:integer external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns a sequence with $num double values between 0.0 (inclusive) and 1.0 (exclusive). The random values are created using the initial seed given in $seed .

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: random:seeded-double
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function random:seeded-double($seed as xs:integer, $num as xs:integer) as xs:double* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns a sequence with $num integer values, either in the whole integer range or between 0 (inclusive) and the given maximum (exclusive). The random values are created using the initial seed given in $seed .
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXRA0001 the maximum value is out of bounds.
bxerr:BXRA0002 the number of values to be returned is negative.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: random:seeded-integer
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function random:seeded-integer($seed as xs:integer, $num as xs:integer) as xs:integer* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns a sequence with $num integer values, either in the whole integer range or between 0 (inclusive) and the given maximum (exclusive). The random values are created using the initial seed given in $seed .
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXRA0001 the maximum value is out of bounds.
bxerr:BXRA0002 the number of values to be returned is negative.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: random:seeded-integer
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function random:seeded-integer($seed as xs:integer, $num as xs:integer, $max as xs:integer) as xs:integer* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns a sequence with $num double values. The random values are Gaussian (i.e. normally) distributed with the mean 0.0. and the derivation 1.0.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: random:gaussian
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function random:gaussian($num as xs:integer) as xs:double* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Creates a random universally unique identifier (UUID), represented as 128-bit value.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: random:uuid
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function random:uuid() as xs:string external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This XQuery Module contains functions for installing, listing and deleting modules contained in the Repository .
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:author: BaseX Team

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Installs a package or replaces an existing package. The parameter $path indicates the path to the package.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXRE0001 the package does not exist.
bxerr:BXRE0002 a package uses an invalid namespace URI.
bxerr:BXRE0003 the package to be installed requires a package which is still not installed.
bxerr:BXRE0004 the package descriptor is invalid.
bxerr:BXRE0005 the module contained in the package to be installed is already installed as part of another package.
bxerr:BXRE0006 the package cannot be parsed.
bxerr:BXRE0009 the package version is not supported.
bxerr:BXRE0010 the package contains an invalid JAR descriptor.
bxerr:BXRE0011 the package contains a JAR descriptor but it cannot be read.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: repo:install
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function repo:install($path as xs:string) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Deletes a package. The parameter $pkg indicates either the package name as specified in the package descriptor or the name, suffixed with a hyphen and the package version.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXRE0007 the package cannot be deleted.
bxerr:BXRE0008 another package depends on the package to be deleted.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: repo:delete
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function repo:delete($pkg as xs:string) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Lists the names and versions of all currently installed packages.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: repo:list
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function repo:list() as element(package)* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This XQuery Module contains functions for retrieving information on an HTTP request that has triggered the query. It is mainly useful in the context of Web Applications . The module is related to Adam Retters EXQuery Request Module draft.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function request:attribute($name as xs:string) as xs:string external

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function request:remote-port() as xs:string external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the names of all query and form field parameters available from the HTTP request. With RESTXQ , this function can be used to access parameters that have not been statically bound by %rest:query-param .

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function request:parameter-names() as xs:string* external

If the parameter does not exist, an empty sequence or the optionally specified default value is returned instead. If both query and form field parameters with the same name exist, the form field values will be attached to the query values.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: request:parameter
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function request:parameter($name as xs:string) as xs:string* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the value of the named query or form field parameter in an HTTP request. If the parameter does not exist, an empty sequence or the optionally specified default value is returned instead. If both query and form field parameters with the same name exist, the form field values will be attached to the query values.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function request:parameter($name as xs:string, $default as xs:string) as xs:string* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the names of all headers available from the HTTP request. If RESTXQ is used, this function can be used to access headers that have not been statically bound by %rest:header-param .

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function request:header-names() as xs:string* external

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function request:header($name as xs:string) as xs:string? external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the value of the named header in an HTTP request. If the header does not exist, an empty sequence or the optionally specified default value is returned instead.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: request:header
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function request:header($name as xs:string, $default as xs:string) as xs:string external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the names of all cookies in the HTTP headers available from the HTTP request. If RESTXQ is used, this function can be used to access cookies that have not been statically bound by %rest:cookie-param .

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function request:cookie-names() as xs:string* external

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function request:cookie($name as xs:string) as xs:string* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This XQuery Module contains functions for accessing and modifying server-side session information. This module is mainly useful in the context of Web Applications .

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function session:get($key as xs:string, $default as item()*) as item()* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This XQuery Module contains functions to access relational databases from XQuery using SQL. With this module, you can execute query, update and prepared statements, and the result sets are returned as sequences of XML elements representing tuples. Each element has children representing the columns returned by the SQL statement.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:author: BaseX Team

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This function initializes a JDBC driver specified via $class . This step might be superfluous if the SQL database is not embedded.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXSQ0007 the specified driver class is not found.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: sql:init
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function sql:init($class as xs:string) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXSQ0001 an SQL exception occurs, e.g. missing JDBC driver or not existing relation.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: sql:connect
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function sql:connect($url as xs:string) as xs:integer external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXSQ0001 an SQL exception occurs, e.g. missing JDBC driver or not existing relation.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: sql:connect
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function sql:connect($url as xs:string, $user as xs:string, $password as xs:string) as xs:integer external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXSQ0001 an SQL exception occurs, e.g. missing JDBC driver or not existing relation.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: sql:connect
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function sql:connect($url as xs:string, $user as xs:string, $password as xs:string, $options as item()) as xs:integer external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This function executes a query or update statement. The parameter $connection specifies a connection handle. The parameter $query is a string representing an SQL statement.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXSQ0001 an SQL exception occurs, e.g. not existing relation is retrieved.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: sql:execute
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function sql:execute($connection as xs:integer, $query as xs:string) as element()* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This function executes a prepared statement. The parameter $id specifies a prepared statement handle. The optional parameter $params is an element <sql:parameters/> representing the parameters for a prepared statement along with their types and values. The following schema shall be used: element sql:parameters { element sql:parameter { attribute type { "int"|"string"|"boolean"|"date"|"double"|"float"|"short"|"time"|"timestamp" }, attribute null { "true"|"false" }?, text }+ }?
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXSQ0001 an SQL exception occurs, e.g. not existing relation is retrieved.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: sql:execute-prepared
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function sql:execute-prepared($id as xs:integer, $params as element(sql:parameters)) as element()* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This function prepares a statement and returns a handle to it. The parameter $connection indicates the connection handle to be used. The parameter $statement is a string representing an SQL statement with one or more '?' placeholders. If the value of a field has to be set to NULL , then the attribute null of the element <sql:parameter/> has to be true .
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXSQ0001 an SQL exception occurs.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: sql:prepare
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function sql:prepare($connection as xs:integer, $statement as xs:string) as xs:integer external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This function commits the changes made to a relational database. $connection specifies the connection handle.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXSQ0001 an SQL exception occurs.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: sql:commit
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function sql:commit($connection as xs:integer) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This function rolls back the changes made to a relational database. $connection specifies the connection handle.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXSQ0001 an SQL exception occurs.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: sql:rollback
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function sql:rollback($connection as xs:integer) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This function closes a connection to a relational database. $connection specifies the connection handle.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXSQ0001 an SQL exception occurs.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: sql:close
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function sql:close($connection as xs:integer) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This XQuery Module contains functions for handling streamable items. In contrast to standard XQuery items, a streamable item contains only a reference to the actual data. The data itself will be retrieved if it is requested by an expression, or if the item is to be serialized. Hence, a streamable item only uses a few bytes, and no additional memory is occupied during serialization. The following BaseX functions return streamable items: Some functions are capable of consuming items in a streamable fashion: data will never be cached, but instead passed on to another target (file, the calling expression, etc.). The following streaming functions are currently available: The XQuery expression below serves as an example on how large files can be downloaded and written to a file with constant memory consumption:
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:author: BaseX Team

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Returns a materialized instance of the specified $value :
if an item is streamable, its value will be retrieved, and a new item containing the value will be returned.
other, non-streamable items will simply be passed through.
Materialization is advisable if a value is to be processed more than once, and is expensive to retrieve. It is get mandatory whenever a value is invalidated before it is requested (see the example below).

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: stream:materialize
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function stream:materialize($value as item()*) as item()* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Checks whether the specified $item is streamable.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: stream:is-streamable
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function stream:is-streamable($item as item()) as item() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This XQuery Module contains annotations and functions for performing XQUnit tests.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:author: BaseX Team

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Asserts that the effective boolean value of the specified $test is true and returns an empty sequence. Otherwise, raises an error. The effective boolean value of an expression can be explicitly computed by using the fn:boolean function. The default failure message can be overridden with the $info argument.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: :UNIT0001 the assertion failed, or an error was raised.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: unit:assert
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function unit:assert($test as item()*) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Asserts that the effective boolean value of the specified $test is true and returns an empty sequence. Otherwise, raises an error. The effective boolean value of an expression can be explicitly computed by using the fn:boolean function. The default failure message can be overridden with the $info argument.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: :UNIT0001 the assertion failed, or an error was raised.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: unit:assert
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function unit:assert($test as item()*, $info as item()) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Asserts that the specified arguments are equal according to the rules of the fn:deep-equals function. Otherwise, raises an error. The default failure message can be overridden with the $info argument.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: :UNIT0001 the assertion failed, or an error was raised.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: unit:assert-equals
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function unit:assert-equals($returned as item()*, $expected as item()*) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Asserts that the specified arguments are equal according to the rules of the fn:deep-equals function. Otherwise, raises an error. The default failure message can be overridden with the $info argument.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: :UNIT0001 the assertion failed, or an error was raised.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: unit:assert-equals
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function unit:assert-equals($returned as item()*, $expected as item()*, $info as item()) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Raises a unit error. The default failure message can be overridden with the $info argument.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: :UNIT0001 default error raised by this function.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: unit:fail
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function unit:fail() as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Raises a unit error. The default failure message can be overridden with the $info argument.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: :UNIT0001 default error raised by this function.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: unit:fail
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function unit:fail($info as item()) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This XQuery Module contains functions for creating and administering database users. The User Management article gives more information on database users and permissions.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns an element sequence, containing all registered users and their permissions. In addition to the SHOW USERS command, encoded password strings and database permissions will be output. A user $name can be specified to filter the results in advance.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Checks if a user with the specified $name exists.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function user:exists($name as xs:string) as xs:boolean external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Creates a new user with the specified $name and $password . The default permission none can be overwritten with the $permission argument. Existing users will be overwritten.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: :name The specified user name is invalid.
:permission The specified permission is invalid.
:admin The "admin" user cannot be modified.
:logged-in The specified user is currently logged in.
:update The operation can only be performed once per user or database pattern.

:admin The "admin" user cannot be modified.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Grants the specified $permission to a user with the specified $name . If a glob $pattern is specified, the permission will only be applied to databases matching that pattern.

:name The specified user name is invalid.
:pattern The specified database pattern is invalid.
:permission The specified permission is invalid.
:admin The "admin" user cannot be modified.
:local A local permission can only be 'none', 'read' or 'write'.
:logged-in The specified user is currently logged in.
:update The operation can only be performed once per user or database pattern.

:name The specified user name is invalid.
:pattern The specified database pattern is invalid.

:local A local permission can only be 'none', 'read' or 'write'.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Drops a user with the specified $name . If a glob $pattern is specified, only the database pattern will be dropped.

:admin The "admin" user cannot be modified.
:logged-in The specified user is currently logged in.
:update The operation can only be performed once per user or database pattern.
:conflict A user cannot be both altered and dropped.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This XQuery Module contains functions to perform validations against XML Schema and Document Type Declarations . By default, this module uses Javas standard validators. As an alternative, Saxon XSLT Processor is used if ( saxon9he.jar , saxon9pe.jar or saxon9ee.jar ) is added to the classpath.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:author: BaseX Team

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Validates the document specified by $input . Both $input and $schema can be specified as:
xs:string, containing the path to the resource,
xs:string, containing the resource in its string representation, or
node(), containing the resource itself.
$schema can be used to specify the schema for validation. If no schema is given, $input is required to contain an xsi:(noNamespace)schemaLocation attribute as defined in W3C XML Schema.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXVA0001 the validation fails.
bxerr:BXVA0002 the validation process cannot be started.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: validate:xsd
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function validate:xsd($input as item()) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function validate:xsd($input as item(), $schema as item()) as empty-sequence() external

node(), containing the resource itself.
$schema can be used to specify the schema for validation. If no schema is given, $input is required to contain an xsi:(noNamespace)schemaLocation attribute as defined in W3C XML Schema.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXVA0002 the validation process cannot be started.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This XQuery Module contains functions for evaluating XQuery strings and modules at runtime.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:author: BaseX Team

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Evaluates the supplied $query string as XQuery expression and returns the resulting items. The evaluated query has its own query context. If a returned node is stored in a database, a main-memory copy will be returned as result, because the referenced database is closed after query execution and will not be accessible anymore. Variables and context items can be declared via $bindings . The specified keys must be QNames or strings:
If a key is a QName, it will be directly adopted as variable name.
It a key is a string, it may be prefixed with a dollar sign. Namespace can be specified using the Clark Notation.
If the specified string is empty, the value will be bound to the context item.
The $options parameter contains evaluation options, which can either be specified
as children of an <xquery:options/> element: <xquery:options> <xquery:permission value="none"/> </xquery:options>
as map, which contains all key/value pairs: map { "permission": "none" }
The following options are available:
permission: the query will be evaluated with the specified permissions (see User Management).
timeout: query execution will be interrupted after the specified number of seconds.
memory: query execution will be interrupted if the specified number of megabytes will be exceeded. This check works best if only one process is running at the same time.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: bxerr:BXXQ0001 the query contains updating expressions .
bxerr:BXXQ0003 insufficient permissions for evaluating the query.
bxerr:BXXQ0004 query execution exceeded timeout or memory constraints.
bxerr:FOTY0013 the expression yields function items.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: xquery:eval
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function xquery:eval($query as xs:string) as item()* external

bxerr:BXXQ0003 insufficient permissions for evaluating the query.
bxerr:BXXQ0004 query execution exceeded timeout or memory constraints.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Parses the specified $query string as XQuery module and returns information on the resulting query plan (please note that the naming of the expressions in the query plan may change over time). The $options parameters can be specified in two ways:
as children of an <xquery:options/> element: <xquery:options> <xquery:compile value="true"/> </xquery:options>
as map, which contains all key/value pairs: map { "compile": true() }
The following options are available:
compile: additionally compiles the query after parsing it. By default, this option is false.
plan: returns an XML representation of the internal query plan. By default, this option is true.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: xquery:parse
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function xquery:parse($query as xs:string) as item()* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:

as children of an <xquery:options/> element: <xquery:options> <xquery:compile value="true"/> </xquery:options>
as map, which contains all key/value pairs: map { "compile": true() }
The following options are available:
compile: additionally compiles the query after parsing it. By default, this option is false.
plan: returns an XML representation of the internal query plan. By default, this option is true.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: xquery:parse
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function xquery:parse($query as xs:string, $options as item()) as item() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Opens $uri as file, evaluates it as XQuery expression at runtime, and returns the resulting items. Database nodes in the result will be copied and returned instead. The semantics of the $bindings and $options parameters is the same as for xquery:eval .

bxerr:BXXQ0003 insufficient permissions for evaluating the query.
bxerr:BXXQ0004 query execution exceeded timeout.
bxerr:FOTY0013 the expression yields function items.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This XQuery Module contains functions and variables to perform XSLT transformations. By default, this module uses Javas XSLT 1.0 Xalan implementation to transform documents. XSLT 2.0 is used instead if Version 9.x of the Saxon XSLT Processor ( saxon9he.jar , saxon9pe.jar , saxon9ee.jar ) is found in the classpath. A custom transformer can be specified by overwriting the system property javax.xml.transform.TransformerFactory , as shown in the following Java example:
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:author: BaseX Team

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the name of the applied XSLT processor, or the path to a custom implementation (currently: "Java", "Saxon EE", "Saxon PE", or "Saxon HE").

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: xslt:processor
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function xslt:processor() as xs:string external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the supported XSLT version (currently: "1.0" or "2.0"). "Unknown" is returned if a custom implementation was chosen.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: xslt:version
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function xslt:version() as xs:string external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Transforms the document specified by $input , using the XSLT template specified by $stylesheet , and returns the result as node. $input and $stylesheet can be specified as
xs:string, containing the path to the document,
xs:string, containing the document in its string representation, or
node(), containing the document itself.
The $params argument can be used to bind variables to a stylesheet, which can either be specified
as children of an <xslt:parameters/> element; e.g.: <xslt:parameters> <xslt:key1 value='value1'/> ... </xslt:parameters>
or as map, which contains all key/value pairs: map { "key1": "value1", ... }
Note that only strings are supported when using Saxon (XSLT 2.0).

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: xslt:transform
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function xslt:transform($input as item(), $stylesheet as item()) as node() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Transforms the document specified by $input , using the XSLT template specified by $stylesheet , and returns the result as node. $input and $stylesheet can be specified as
xs:string, containing the path to the document,
xs:string, containing the document in its string representation, or
node(), containing the document itself.
The $params argument can be used to bind variables to a stylesheet, which can either be specified
as children of an <xslt:parameters/> element; e.g.: <xslt:parameters> <xslt:key1 value='value1'/> ... </xslt:parameters>
or as map, which contains all key/value pairs: map { "key1": "value1", ... }
Note that only strings are supported when using Saxon (XSLT 2.0).

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: xslt:transform
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function xslt:transform($input as item(), $stylesheet as item(), $params as item()) as node() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Transforms the document specified by $input , using the XSLT template specified by $stylesheet , and returns the result as string. The parameters are the same as described for xslt:transform .

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: xslt:transform-text
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function xslt:transform-text($input as item(), $stylesheet as item()) as xs:string external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Transforms the document specified by $input , using the XSLT template specified by $stylesheet , and returns the result as string. The parameters are the same as described for xslt:transform .

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: xslt:transform-text
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function xslt:transform-text($input as item(), $stylesheet as item(), $params as item()) as xs:string external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This XQuery Module contains functions to handle ZIP archives. The contents of ZIP files can be extracted and listed, and new archives can be created. The module is based on the EXPath ZIP Module . It may soon be replaced by the Archive Module .
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:author: BaseX Team

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Extracts the binary file at $path within the ZIP file located at $uri and returns it as an xs:base64Binary item.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: experr:ZIP0001 the specified path does not exist.
experr:ZIP0003 the operation fails for some other reason.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: zip:binary-entry
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function zip:binary-entry($uri as xs:string, $path as xs:string) as xs:base64Binary external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Extracts the text file at $path within the ZIP file located at $uri and returns it as an xs:string item. An optional encoding can be specified via $encoding .
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: experr:ZIP0001 the specified path does not exist.
experr:ZIP0003 the operation fails for some other reason.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: zip:text-entry
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function zip:text-entry($uri as xs:string, $path as xs:string) as xs:string external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Extracts the text file at $path within the ZIP file located at $uri and returns it as an xs:string item. An optional encoding can be specified via $encoding .
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: experr:ZIP0001 the specified path does not exist.
experr:ZIP0003 the operation fails for some other reason.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: zip:text-entry
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function zip:text-entry($uri as xs:string, $path as xs:string, $encoding as xs:string) as xs:string external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Extracts the XML file at $path within the ZIP file located at $uri and returns it as a document node.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: experr:FODC0006 the addressed file is not well-formed.
experr:ZIP0001 the specified path does not exist.
experr:ZIP0003 the operation fails for some other reason.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: zip:xml-entry
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function zip:xml-entry($uri as xs:string, $path as xs:string) as document-node() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Extracts the HTML file at $path within the ZIP file located at $uri and returns it as a document node. The file is converted to XML first if Tagsoup is found in the classpath.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: experr:FODC0006 the addressed file is not well-formed, or cannot be converted to correct XML.
experr:ZIP0001 the specified path does not exist.
experr:ZIP0003 the operation fails for some other reason.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: zip:html-entry
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function zip:html-entry($uri as xs:string, $path as xs:string) as document-node() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Generates an ZIP XML Representation of the hierarchical structure of the ZIP file located at $uri and returns it as an element node. The file contents are not returned by this function.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: experr:ZIP0001 the specified path does not exist.
experr:ZIP0003 the operation fails for some other reason.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: zip:entries
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function zip:entries($uri as xs:string) as element(zip:file) external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Creates a new ZIP archive with the characteristics described by $zip , the ZIP XML Representation .
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: experr:ZIP0001 an addressed file does not exist.
experr:ZIP0002 entries in the ZIP archive description are unknown, missing, or invalid.
experr:ZIP0003 the operation fails for some other reason.
experr:Serialization Errors an inlined XML fragment cannot be successfully serialized.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: zip:zip-file
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function zip:zip-file($zip as element(zip:file)) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Updates an existing ZIP archive or creates a modifed copy, based on the characteristics described by $zip , the ZIP XML Representation . The $output argument is the URI where the modified ZIP file is copied to.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: experr:ZIP0001 an addressed file does not exist.
experr:ZIP0002 entries in the ZIP archive description are unknown, missing, or invalid.
experr:ZIP0003 the operation fails for some other reason.
experr:Serialization Errors an inlined XML fragment cannot be successfully serialized.
